title: Freedom for thousands of mortgage prisoners as City watchdog relaxes rules for banks
text:
Around 30,000 homeowners who are stuck on expensive mortgage deals but unable to switch have been given the freedom to move elsewhere.

These so-called "mortgage prisoners" have been paying over the odds for years but have not been able to remortgage to a cheaper deal because they are unable to pass the strict affordability tests that banks apply to new customers.

In many cases, borrowers have been told they cannot afford a new mortgage deal even though the monthly cost would be lower than what they are currently paying.
